page.title: 04The canal
page.content: When the canal was built it stretched from{Nottingham to Grantham. It was opened in 1797. It took four years to build and cost Â£100,000. The main use for the{Grantham Canal}was to transport coal and night soil from Nottingham to Grantham and farm products were brought from there back to Nottingham. The canal prospered for fifty years until the coming of the railways. Today the canal is not used but it is being restored by the{Grantham {Canal Preservation Society.}Now you can find all of the common wild flowers of Britain growing along its banks. Some sections can now be used again by small craft. Water birds and other wildlife live by it.
